definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To walk or travel fast; to go quickly.
( intransitive ) To run away hastily; scram .
examples: You'd better scoot before my mother gets home and sees that broken window!

definitions.definition: ( of an animal ) To move with the forelegs while sitting, so that the floor rubs against its rear end.
examples: The dog was scooting all over our new carpet.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , often with over ) To move sideways (especially along a seat for multiple people), usually to make room for someone else (to sit, stand, etc.).
examples: Do you mind scooting a bit to the left?
Would you mind scooting over for me?

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To dispatch someone or something at speed; Synonym of shoo .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To walk or travel fast; to go quickly.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To run away hastily; scram .
( of an animal ) To move with the forelegs while sitting, so that the floor rubs against its rear end.
( intransitive , often with over ) To move sideways (especially along a seat for multiple people), usually to make room for someone else (to sit, stand, etc.).
( transitive ) To dispatch someone or something at speed; Synonym of shoo .

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To ride on a scooter .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To ride on a scooter .
